stream_context.summary: Kaze live-builds Course 12, a Western/cowboy stage, discussing layout, visuals, mission design and technical constraints while chatting with the audience.
level: cowboy stage (working names: Wild West Valley)

development_findings.summary: Course 12 will have three connected sub-areas: a central town, a valley playground, and a train-headquarters/gold-mine section, with two train stations that allow fast travel between areas 1 and 3.

The core design hook is ‘capture three outlaws’: a Snuffit shoot-out in a saloon back-room, a bank-robbing Monty Mole whose tunnel leaves a trail, and five Goombas stacked in a trench-coat who robbed a train.
development_findings.quote: There will be three bosses here… every single one of them will be a star, and you will put them in jail after you catch them.

development_findings.summary: Additional content includes a saloon serving only milk, a sheriff’s office with jail, Koopa Bank, cowboy hat shop, Yoshi farm, Yoshi coin scavenger hunt in area 2, an 8-bit sub-area in the canyon, mine-cart red-coin section, tumbleweeds and giant cacti.
Visual influences cited: Twilight Princess Hidden Village, Wario’s Gold Mine, Yoshi Valley, Mario Party Western Land, Kalimari Desert and the ‘Cowboy Cats’ Instagram aesthetic.

Kaze is iterating on building style: wants cartoonish wooden storefronts that ‘pop’ without colour vomit; experimented with slanted vs. straight walls, saturation tweaks, complementary palettes and blue vs. orange fog before settling on blue fog and vibrant but limited colours.
development_findings.quote: Finding the art style always takes a while… I think the blue fog looks better.

development_findings.summary: Elevated sky-bridge train tracks (à la Wario’s Gold Mine) will cross above the town to create spectacle and allow aggressive frustum culling for N64 performance.
development_findings.quote: What if the whole city was kind of around a mountain and you see the train drive over Mario?

development_findings.summary: Technical toolchain: Blender + Fast64 exporter into SM64 decomp; uses global fog material, 64×64 textures when possible; concerned that level-wide fog forces 2-cycle materials which hurts performance.
development_findings.quote: Unfortunately, this means everything is going to be a 2-cycle material, which is really, really bad.

development_findings.summary: Development pace has slowed since finishing Course 9 because Kaze now has a full-time job.
development_findings.quote: Development has slowed down ever since the end of course 9, because I have a full-time job now.

development_findings.summary: Nintendo DMCA strikes removed Kaze’s public tutorials, so toolchain documentation is no longer available.
development_findings.quote: Nintendo took all my tutorials down.

development_findings.summary: Pending tasks for the stage: finalise building palette, draw overhead map (done in MS Paint on stream), grey-box/block-out, refine visuals, implement train logic and boss behaviours.

context_findings.summary: Kaze prioritises ‘rule of cool’ over strict realism, aiming for exaggerated, tongue-in-cheek cowboy tropes (‘cowboyaboo’).
context_findings.quote: This is supposed to be like a goofy, funny cowboy town, not dark, gritty.

context_findings.summary: He jokes about workplace culture (wearing a cowboy hat to programming meetings) and notes boss greets people with ‘howdy’.
Personal stance: he doesn’t drink alcohol; the saloon only serves milk for comedic effect.
context_findings.quote: I don’t drink… The saloon will only serve milk.

context_findings.summary: Kaze multi-streams to Twitch and YouTube, monitors donations and song requests as part of community engagement.
Expresses frustration with Twitch ‘nudity’ controversies and dismisses drama as irrelevant to development.
context_findings.quote: I actually care so little about the whole Twitch nudity thing… Who gives a shit?

context_findings.summary: Brief personal moment: Zeina (spouse/animator) arrives home during stream, indicating shared workspace.
context_findings.quote: Zayna just came home… I can hear her talking to someone.

biobak.summary: Provided ongoing feedback on building colours and saturation, suggesting more vibrant palettes and referencing Odyssey/Sand Kingdom; also directed Kaze to certain example screenshots (some in jest).

badub.summary: Surprised Kaze mid-stream with an original 3½-minute Western track tailored for Course 12, immediately influencing fog and colour decisions.
badub.quote: He just sent me that… That’s so perfect. I love this.

zeina.summary: No direct design input in this stream, but her off-screen presence was noted when she returned home.

key_stories.title: Outlaw Boss Trio
key_stories.summary: Kaze outlines a mini-narrative where Mario helps the sheriff capture three comedic outlaws, each becoming a star mission.
key_stories.challenge: Make mission objectives fit the Western theme and feel fresh within SM64 mechanics.
key_stories.process: Brainstorms scenarios: Snuffit saloon hold-up, mole tunnelling into the bank, and five Goombas in a trench-coat train robbery, aligning each with level geography.
key_stories.outcome: Three distinct boss concepts locked in, reinforcing level identity and jail hub.
key_stories.key_quote: Every single one of them will be a star, and you will put them in jail after you catch them.

key_stories.title: Finding the Right Western Palette
key_stories.summary: Kaze struggles to balance cartoony vibrance with readability and N64 limits. He tests wood textures, fog colours, saturation and reference images while chat (esp. Biobak) debates each tweak.
key_stories.challenge: Buildings looked dull or ‘colour vomit’, and global fog creates performance costs.
key_stories.process: Iterative texture swaps, HSV experiments, blue vs. orange fog trials, elevation ideas, reference to Wario’s Gold Mine and AI-generated concept art.
key_stories.outcome: Settles on blue fog, cleaner low-contrast wood, vibrant facades and elevated train tracks; next step is block-out.
key_stories.key_quote: Finding the art style always takes a while… Blue fog is good to go.

key_stories.title: A Surprise Score
key_stories.summary: Composer Badub privately sends a custom Western track during the stream, instantly energising Kaze and shaping the ambience discussion.
key_stories.challenge: Stage needed music that captures a playful cowboy feel.
key_stories.process: Badub delivers track; Kaze plays it live, gauges vibe, notes it ‘needs fog’, and loops it while sketching layout.
key_stories.outcome: Track accepted as Course 12 theme; informs visual/atmospheric choices.
key_stories.key_quote: Yo, that’s so perfect. I love this.

open_questions.context: Kaze wants a constantly moving train with sky-bridge tracks for spectacle and culling but worries about N64 limits.
questions: How will the train be scripted to run continuously without frame-drops?
Will the player be able to ride or platform on it mid-level?
What culling or LOD tricks are planned to keep it performant?

open_questions.context: Kaze mentions a multi-step clue hunt but did not detail its design.
questions: What types of clues and interactions will guide the player?
How will the scavenger hunt differentiate itself from earlier red-coin or collectathon missions?

open_questions.context: Working title ‘Wild West Valley’ deemed bland; no replacement chosen.
questions: What candidate names are on the table now?
Is there a thematic or pun direction the team wants?

open_questions.context: Zeina’s role as animator was not shown in this session.
questions: Which Course 12 assets require bespoke animation?
How do she and Kaze coordinate art pipeline and deadlines?

open_questions.context: Badub delivered a track in-progress via DM.
questions: What is the workflow for importing new music into the ROM hack?
Are there technical constraints (channel count, sample rate) that shape composition?
